description.narrative: Institutional capacity building for RWH in Ethiopia

Institutional sustainability : the RHCC organize trainings and meetings to develop similar consciousness on WASH and RWH activities with its partner organizations and other WASH organizations. the local implementing partners are clear about their tasks and independently carry out their tasks with technical and financial support from the RHCC. Technical sustainability : The RHCC make sure that the technologies applied fit in to the local context to insure technical sustainability

Production & distribution of communication/technical materials such as leaflets/ flyers, posters, booklets, brochures etc on 3R, RWH and MUS Conduct networking and alliance building discussion workshop (FLoWS) Organize one local exposition workshop to initiate public or professional debates, Attend international expositions workshops, trainings or conferences like RHCC & SEARNET Conduct site verifications, baseline survey & provide technical assistance in replacement site selections & designing Monitoring and Evaluation (at least once per year for 4 partners) Suitability mapping on 3R/ MUS
The RHCC make sure that the technologies applied fit in to the local context to insure technical sustainability

The effort to develop RHCC in the Water and Sanitation sector in Ethiopia has a goal to Contribute for livelihood & improvement of the Ethiopian communities through enhanced RWH/WaSH/MUS service delivery by creating a dynamic water-centered knowledge driven centre focusing on pro-poor RWH and WASH services for sustainable WASH intervention. It provides a knowledge base for the promotion of appropriate and sustainable RWH and WASH to address multiple water needs of vulnerable communities.

The project is on supporting and capacity building of the RHCC in Ethiopia. The RHCC will promote RWH knowledge and technologies implement RWH projects on ground. the RHCC is focused on pro-poor RWH and WASH activities for food security, domestic and public use
